page.title: 05SHELL COTTAGE * HEDGERLEY
page.content: Shell Cottage is a two story cottage under a tiled roof and built in 1679. It was called Shell Cottage because it was known to have a shell pattern on the roof. The bricks are red and blue and like Garden Cottage they were made in the Hedgerley Brick Kiln. The lower extension was added in 1799. All the windows have wooden frames, above the fireplace there is a beautifully carved piece of wood, carved in the late 17th century. The original staircase and doors are still there. In 1901 the owners of Hedgerley Manor bought the cottage, they took down some of the carving from the fireplace, but the top was left incase it fell down. Because of the window tax in 1799 some of the windows were blocked,where this has happened there are no blue bricks. The house might have been a farm or country house.
